content.description: Huge overhanging chimney which is not as bad as it sounds. Lots of fun to TR!
content.protection: Large Trad gear. Best to TR from "Cooler" anchors.
content.location: To the left of "Cooler than my Kids..." Look for the tree and the giant chimney.

climbs.name: I'm Cooler Than My Kids Think I Am

content.description: Thin seam past 4 bots to an airy step left up the face past 3 more bolts to the chains.
content.location: Just left of lunch rock and Crepes Corner

content.description: Same start as "But My Wife..." up past 3 bolts step left to a giant knob into the chimney.  Wild stemming back to the face is the crux.
content.location: About 20 meters left of lunch rock Crepes Corner area

content.description: Super slabby route. Stay on the right flake to start, and transition across the upper slab to a left crack to finish. Fun easy warm-up!
content.location: It’s the furthest right bolted route on the wall

content.description: Same first bolt as Gimpy.. but immediately up the bald face to undercling then left to pinches and friction. 9 Bolts to the chains
Face start to a long reach for jugs. Difficult if you're under 5'9". A few powerful moves back to face. Then follow the bolts up and left to the top.
content.location:
2nd from the left and same start as "Grippy..."

You can scramble to the top to set up a TR.

content.description: Start at the nadir of the entire wall. Use a bouldery undercling and fancy footwork to gain the insecure flairing ramp, then delicately step right into the thin detached features. Work your way up the old "Cruise Control" route and finish at the apex of the wall.
content.location: Goes from the absolute lowest to the absolute highest point. So fun!

content.description: Direct start in the left leaning crack/ trough up through a semi detached lie back flake to thin face moves past two bolts to a flat shelf.  Then up a left leaning 5.7 crack that requires a small rack of trad gear. Chains at the top.
content.protection: Mix of 2 bolts and a small rack from 2" to small nuts.
content.location: Optional meandering start from "But my wife..."

content.description: Head up a slabby trough with oppositional pressure to a flaring crack. After clipping the second bolt do a crazy crossing reach to the jug rail that allows you swing over under the black knobby features. This move is more difficult for shorter climbers. Follow the face climbing finish of "Gimpy Old Men" to the mussy hooks.
content.location: Leftmost climb at Middle Aged Wall.

climbs.name: But My Wife Got A Boob Job

content.description: Start up the easy slab steps to the steep face. A little bit of face/stemming gets you past the crux to the chains
